description: From Russian пуд (pud). Doublet of pound.

entries.meaning: An obsolete Russian unit of mass, equal to 40 Russian funt, or about 16.38 kg (approximately 36.11 pounds).
examples: About 250,000 poods of yuft are prepared annually, of which about 150,000 poods are red yuft, manufactured chiefly for foreign markets.

entries.meaning: A Russian unit of mass used for kettlebells, now rounded off to 16 kg (about 35.274 pounds).
